content:
Re: More versioning thoughts.

Larry Masinter (masinter@parc.xerox.com)
Thu, 6 Jun 1996 23:56:10 PDT

  • Messages sorted by: [ date ][ thread ][ subject ][ author ]
  • Next message: Larry Masinter: "Re: Versioning Thoughts (in HTML)"
  • Previous message: David G. Durand: "Re: High-level capabilities"
  • Maybe in reply to: Andre van der Hoek: "More versioning thoughts."
  • Next in thread: David J. Fiander: "Re: More versioning thoughts." 
Sometimes you can get people to agree on the answer even when they
can't agree on the question. So I'm not so worried about divergent
goals. On the other hand, a Functional Requirements document would be
the right way to deal with the issue of common goals. Does someone
(not me) want to draft a Functional Requirements document and submit
it by next Thursday as an Internet Draft? (Mainly just to raise
awareness of the issue.)

I was hoping also that some things would get discussed at a July 8 f2f
meeting at NaviSoft, but I hadn't heard back about whether the July 10
meeting could get moved. (The DMA technical committee meets in the SF
bay area July 9-12.)

If Navisoft can't host on July 8, I could probably arrange to host the
meeting at Xerox PARC.

Larry
